summary: The Willis Tower, often still called the Sears Tower, is a super-tall building in Chicago, Illinois. It stands at 1,451 feet (442.3 m) tall with 110 stories, making it one of the tallest buildings in the world. Designed by Bruce Graham and Fazlur Rahman Khan, it opened in 1973 and held the title of the world's tallest building for almost 25 years. Over 1.7 million people visit its Skydeck each year. The tower is shaped like nine square tubes grouped together, with a facade of aluminum and black glass. Originally home to the Sears company, it now houses various tenants, with United Airlines as the largest.
title: Willis Tower
